text: Draught @ JW Sweetman, Dublin, shared with Niilstrong. Clear amber - red color, medium sized quite dense off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, lightly hops, bitter. Decent body, medium carbonation. Ok beer.

Draught. Pours a dark amber red with a fading off white head, good pacing around the glass. Aroma of red fruits, toffee, soy sauce. Taste is of more red fruits, strawberry, cherries, toffee, pine, nuts. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.
Draft. A red beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel, leading to a dry finish.
On tap at sweetman brewery pub in Dublin. Amber with off white head. Sweet Malty with caramel and a little hay. Semi sweet with low bitterness and low carbonation.

Draft pour at the source. The beer is a clear red with a medium sized white head of foam. The aroma is toasty and caramelly. The taste lends more of a lightly sweet toffee. Medium body and medium carbonation.

On tap at JW Sweetman, pours a clear amber with a small beige head. Nose and flavour are clean but pretty restrained, with cereal notes and bready caramel notes. Restrained and clean, but pretty boring. I dont understand why this is rated so well. Pretty ordinary.

As the name suggests, the beer has a deep red color. The formation of foam is minimal. The smell is really strong. It is sour and sweet, fruity and hoppy. The taste is great. It has the hop aroma of an IPA, but milder. The citrusy hop aroma is really refreshing. Really nice beer.

Eines der besten Rotbiere die ich je getrunken habe. Intensiv im Geschmack, mit Noten von Fass, Karamell und Trockenfrüchten. Viel Kohlensäure für ein Red Ale, was aber hervorragend passt. Tolles Bier!
Very red, not much of a head on it. A bit of fizz. Slightly fruity taste. Not bad, but I preferred the porter.
The first red beer I have been impressed with in a long time. Great taste and aroma for a red

draught @ ireland. Appearance: pours cloudy red with good off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, caramel berries and floral/herbal notes, palette: medium carbonation, medium body, some caramel sweetness, medium bitterness, average duration, dry finish and a watery texture. Overall: good red ale
Tap, amber pour, white head, nose is sweet, taste is sweet, caramel, dark fruit
Ruby red, medium low head. Typical red ale aromas, above average flowers and herbs. Overall good. On tap at Sweetman brewpub in Dublin.
Astringent. Acetaldehyde type aroma. Off red appearance. Woody flavor. Dry finish.
Draught. Excellent lacing. Aroma is heavy malty, earthy, with some caramel. Light bitterness. Very good.
Im Geruch röstig, leicht verbrannt. Geschmack ebenso. Nett. Bitter im Abgang.
Tap at the brewpub, deep mahogany with a fine head, faint choc and malt nose, nutty malty and slightly sweet body. Decent.

Keg at the brewpub in Dublin. Red/amber with a very thin head. Nose is mild roastiness with some liquorice. Taste is very light spiciness, some mild coffee, plenty of sweet maltiness. Mouthfeel is quite full, with decent carbonation. Good stuff.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: on tap. Smooth in the beginning. The beer starts malty with earthy hints, that gets more intense to the mainpart. Floral-smooth, caramel. The aftertaste is smooth, floral, sweetish-bitter. Nice for a Red Ale. 10/12/11/10
Pint at sweetmans. Caramel nuts not much bitterness. Carbonation is low. Unbalanced, and body too light

Tap at the brewery. Pours like a red ale should. Ruby red with a small, firm beige head. Nose is light floral hops and light toffee biscuit. Balance comes through well on this one. Floral hops with a sweet caramel base and dough. Solid

I thought this was too highly carbonated for a red ale. After pouring nicely the head took on a life of its own and grew up out of the glass, with various shades of off white. Strong malt flavor up front, and malty finish with little bitterness. Would have preferred more of a balance but its not a bad drink at all, just a bit gassy.

Dark red/amber pour with creamy off white head and lace. Aroma is caramel malt and earthy hop tones. Caramel malt and earthy hop flavors with a decent bitter finish. Medium body with good carbonation. Nice beer at 4.3%, easy drinker clean and crisp.
Murky red with a thin tan head. Aroma is light roast malt. Flavour is fruity malt, medium bitter base on a creamy texture

Keg at jw sweetman
Pale chestnut, offwhite head. Slight watermelon on aroma, light body, raspberry tartness?, creamy texture

Keg @ J W Sweetmans, Dublin [140813]
Dark amber, clear, dense white thin head
Aroma - Soft caramel malts, some soft spicy hops
Taste - Caramel malts, soft spicy bit peppery hops, slight herbal notes, toffee malts
Palate - Light body, bit oily, smooth, bit soapy mouthfeel. Finish - soft spicy caramel malts
Overall - Nice easy going beer, just not as good as others in their range

On draught at Sweetmans. No notes, from memory. Amber pour, off white head, looks great. Nose is not as pronounced as the rest of the range, toasted malt, hints of caramel. Flavour is more toasted malt and a little toffee sweetness. Quite light bodied, highly carbonated and not much of a finish. OK.
On tap at the brewpub in Dublin. A decent Irish Red Ale. Not very complex, but enjoyable session ale. I liked it.
Dark red colour, slightly malty aroma and taste. A nice little red ale, but nothing too spectacular.

Keg at JWS. Deep ruby with nice white head. Aroma gives caramel, some red berries and some earthiness. Caramel hits first up on tasting, followed by some nice fruitiness, earthy notes, and a bit of an orangey hop bite. Lingering caramel and earthy hop notes. Not a favourite style of mine, but this is one of the better ones out there.

Appearance: amber red, medium off white head. Aroma: sweet, some decent (and unexpected) hoppiness in there, malty too with a slight floral edge to it. Flavour: Biscuit caramel at first, good amount of hops then shines through, floral again with a decent sweet malty finish. If only more Irish ales were like this the reputation might be raised. Nice.
Tap at J.W.Sweetman, Dublin: Amber coloured brew with an fine somelike American hoppy taste and great hints of caramel.
The head is ok, the body darkred. It smells malty-intensive, hoppy. The taste. The taste is malty, hoppy, a bit bitter-aromatic, flowery. NIce! 12/11/11/11/-/11
